basics-of-humanoid-robotics.title: Basics of Humanoid Robotics
basics-of-humanoid-robotics.description: This chapter delves into the foundational aspects of humanoid robotics, covering their design, locomotion, manipulation, and interaction capabilities.

capstone.title: Capstone
capstone.description: This capstone chapter integrates the concepts learned throughout the textbook to build a simple, end-to-end AI-robot pipeline. It demonstrates how different components—from perception and reasoning to action—work together in a practical application.

digital-twin-simulation.title: Digital Twin Simulation (Gazebo + Isaac)
digital-twin-simulation.description: This chapter explores the concept of digital twins in robotics, focusing on their implementation using simulation environments like Gazebo and NVIDIA Isaac Sim. Digital twins are virtual models of physical systems, crucial for development, testing, and optimization.

introduction-to-physical-ai.title: Introduction to Physical AI
introduction-to-physical-ai.description: This chapter introduces the fundamental concepts of Physical AI, exploring how artificial intelligence can be embodied in physical systems to interact with the real world.

ros-2-fundamentals.title: ROS 2 Fundamentals
ros-2-fundamentals.description: This chapter introduces the Robot Operating System 2 (ROS 2), a flexible framework for writing robot software. It covers core concepts, tools, and best practices for developing distributed robotic applications.

vision-language-action-systems.title: Vision-Language-Action Systems
vision-language-action-systems.description: This chapter explores the cutting-edge field of Vision-Language-Action (VLA) systems, which integrate computer vision, natural language understanding, and robotic control to enable robots to understand high-level commands and perform complex tasks in diverse environments.
